intro: Ligusticum rockii, commonly known as the Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Ligusticum rockii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
